description:
## Theory
SIoTRx supports functions using the ***function*** label. The ***return*** tag is used to return a value.
```
<#function name param1 paramN...>
	Rules
	<#return returnValue>
</#function>
```
Notice that if the last parameter includes a trailing ellipsis, the function will take a variable number of parameters.

Another similar structure is a ***macro***. Macros, unlike functions, do not return any value, although they can be used to generate outputs. In some way they can be compared to void methods from programming languages.

To learn more about functions and macros, visit the [ Apache FreeMarker Manual](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_directives.html).
## Hands-on
### Task
Given the two arrays of numbers and a number:
1. Write a function that adds two values.
2. Use the previous function inside both loops to print the sum between each item and the *number* value.
user_template:
<#assign values1=[1,2]>
<#assign values2=[2,3]>
<#assign number=10>

<#list values1 as item>
<#-- WRITE BELOW -->

</#list>

<#list values2 as item>
<#-- WRITE BELOW -->

</#list>

<#-- WRITE BELOW -->
solution_template:
<#assign values1=[1,2]>
<#assign values2=[2,3]>
<#assign number=10>

<#list values1 as item>
<#-- WRITE BELOW -->
[=add(item,number)]
</#list>

<#list values2 as item>
<#-- WRITE BELOW -->
[=add(item,number)]
</#list>

<#-- WRITE BELOW -->
<#function add x1 x2>
<#return x1+x2>
</#function>
